intro: Achillea lanulosa subsp. typica, commonly known as the woolly yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, silver-white foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial species that produces numerous slender, branching stems. Its botanical features make it a hardy and ornamental plant often cultivated in gardens.
